* The main class for the Rei task management application.
* Rei is a personal task manager that helps users keep track of various types of tasks
* Constructs a new Rei application instance.
* Initializes the user interface, storage system, and loads existing tasks from file.
* @throws ReiExceptions if there's an error loading tasks from storage
* Starts the main execution loop of the Rei application.
* Displays the welcome message and continuously processes user commands
* until the user issues an exit command.
* Entry point for the Rei application.
* @throws ReiExceptions if there's an error initializing the application
public static void main(String[] args) throws ReiExceptions {
* Command to exit the Rei application.
* Displays a farewell message and signals the application to terminate.
* Executes the bye command by displaying a farewell message.
* @param tasks the TaskList (not used in this command)
* @param ui the Ui for displaying the farewell message
* @param storage the Storage (not used in this command)
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Indicates that this command should terminate the application.
* @return true to signal that the application should exit
* Abstract base class for all commands in the Rei application.
* Each command represents a specific action that can be performed on the task list.
* Executes the command with the provided task list, user interface, and storage.
* @param tasks the task list to operate on
* @param ui the user interface for displaying output
* @param storage the storage system for persisting tasks
* @throws ReiExceptions if there's an error executing the command
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage)
* Checks if this command should terminate the application.
* @return true if this command should exit the application, false otherwise
* Command to create and add a new deadline task to the task list.
* A deadline task must be completed by a specific date and time.
* Constructs a new DeadlineCommand with the specified description and deadline.
* @param description the description of the deadline task
* @param ddl the deadline date and time when the task must be completed
* Executes the deadline command by creating a new deadline task and adding it to the task list.
* Also saves the updated task list to storage and displays confirmation to the user.
* @param tasks the TaskList to add the new deadline task to
* @param ui the Ui for displaying confirmation messages
* @param storage the Storage for persisting the updated task list
* @throws ReiExceptions if there's an error saving to storage
public void execute (TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage)
ui.show("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.show("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Command to delete a task from the task list.
* Removes the specified task and saves the changes to storage.
* Constructs a new DeleteCommand with the specified task index.
* @param index the 0-based index of the task to delete
* Executes the delete command by removing the specified task from the task list.
* Also saves the updated task list to storage and displays confirmation to the user.
* @param tasks the TaskList containing the task to delete
* @param ui the Ui for displaying confirmation messages
* @param storage the Storage for persisting the updated task list
* @throws ReiExceptions if the task index is invalid or there's an error saving to storage
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage)
ui.show("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " task(s) in the list.");
* Command to create and add a new event task to the task list.
* An event task occurs during a specific time period with start and end times.
* Constructs a new EventCommand with the specified description, start time, and end time.
* @param description the description of the event
* @param start the start date and time of the event
* @param end the end date and time of the event
public EventCommand(String description, LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end) {
* Executes the event command by creating a new event task and adding it to the task list.
* Also saves the updated task list to storage and displays confirmation to the user.
* @param tasks the TaskList to add the new event task to
* @param ui the Ui for displaying confirmation messages
* @param storage the Storage for persisting the updated task list
* @throws ReiExceptions if there's an error saving to storage
public void execute (TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage)
ui.show("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.show("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Command to find and display tasks that contain a specific keyword.
* Performs case-insensitive search through task descriptions.
* Constructs a new FindCommand with the specified search keyword.
* @param keyword the keyword to search for in task descriptions
* Executes the find command by searching for tasks containing the keyword.
* Displays all matching tasks or a message if no matches are found.
* @param tasks the TaskList to search through
* @param ui the Ui for displaying search results
* @param storage the Storage (not used in this command)
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
ui.show("No tasks match the keyword: " + keyword);
ui.show("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
* Command to display all tasks in the task list.
* Shows each task with its index number, type, status, and description.
* Executes the list command by displaying all tasks in the task list.
* @param tasks the TaskList containing all tasks to display
* @param ui the Ui for displaying output to the user
* @param storage the Storage (not used in this command)
* @throws ReiExceptions if there's an error displaying the tasks
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage)
ui.show("Here are the tasks in your list:");
* Command to mark a task as completed.
* Updates the task's status and saves the changes to storage.
* Constructs a new MarkCommand with the specified task index.
* @param index the 0-based index of the task to mark as done
* Executes the mark command by marking the specified task as completed.
* Also saves the updated task list to storage and displays confirmation to the user.
* @param tasks the TaskList containing the task to mark
* @param ui the Ui for displaying confirmation messages
* @param storage the Storage for persisting the updated task list
* @throws ReiExceptions if the task index is invalid or there's an error saving to storage
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage)
ui.show("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Command to create and add a new todo task to the task list.
* A todo task is a simple task without any time constraints.
* Constructs a new TodoCommand with the specified task description.
* @param description the description of the todo task to create
* Executes the todo command by creating a new todo task and adding it to the task list.
* Also saves the updated task list to storage and displays confirmation to the user.
* @param tasks the TaskList to add the new todo task to
* @param ui the Ui for displaying confirmation messages
* @param storage the Storage for persisting the updated task list
* @throws ReiExceptions if there's an error saving to storage
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage)
ui.show("Got it. I've added this task:");
ui.show("Now you have " + tasks.size() + " tasks in the list.");
* Command to mark a task as not completed.
* Updates the task's status and saves the changes to storage.
* Constructs a new UnmarkCommand with the specified task index.
* @param index the 0-based index of the task to mark as not done
* Executes the unmark command by marking the specified task as not completed.
* Also saves the updated task list to storage and displays confirmation to the user.
* @param tasks the TaskList containing the task to unmark
* @param ui the Ui for displaying confirmation messages
* @param storage the Storage for persisting the updated task list
* @throws ReiExceptions if the task index is invalid or there's an error saving to storage
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage)
ui.show("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Custom exception class for the Rei application.
* Used to handle application-specific error conditions with user-friendly messages.
* Constructs a new ReiExceptions with the specified error message.
* @param message the detail message explaining the error condition
* Manages a list of tasks with operations for adding, removing, and modifying tasks.
* Provides a wrapper around ArrayList with additional task-specific functionality.
* Constructs a new TaskList with the provided list of tasks.
* @param tasks the initial list of tasks
* Adds a task to the end of the task list.
* Retrieves a task at the specified index.
* @param index the 0-based index of the task to retrieve
* @return the task at the specified index
* @throws ReiExceptions if the index is out of bounds
public Task get(int index) throws ReiExceptions {
* Removes and returns the task at the specified index.
* @param index the 0-based index of the task to remove
* @throws ReiExceptions if the index is out of bounds
public Task remove(int index) throws ReiExceptions {
* Marks the task at the specified index as completed.
* @param index the 0-based index of the task to mark as done
* @throws ReiExceptions if the index is out of bounds
public void markDone(int index) throws ReiExceptions {
* Marks the task at the specified index as not completed.
* @param index the 0-based index of the task to mark as undone
* @throws ReiExceptions if the index is out of bounds
public void markUndone(int index) throws ReiExceptions {
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* @return the size of the task list
* Returns the last task added to the list.
* Returns the underlying ArrayList containing all tasks.
* Validates that the given index is within the valid range of the task list.
* @throws ReiExceptions if the index is negative or exceeds the list size
private void checkIndex(int index) throws ReiExceptions {
throw new ReiExceptions("OOPS!!! That task number is invalid.");
* Parses user input strings and converts them into appropriate Command objects.
* Handles the interpretation of various command formats and their parameters.
* Parses the user input string and returns the corresponding Command object.
* @param input the user input string to parse
* @return the Command object representing the user's intended action
* @throws ReiExceptions if the input format is invalid or unrecognized
public static Command parse(String input) throws ReiExceptions {
throw new ReiExceptions("Find command requires a keyword.");
throw new ReiExceptions("OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
throw new ReiExceptions("OOPS!!! Deadline must have /by.");
throw new ReiExceptions("OOPS!!! The description cannot be empty.");
throw new ReiExceptions("OOPS!!! Please use yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm format.");
throw new ReiExceptions("OOPS!!! An event must have /from and /to.");
throw new ReiExceptions("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
* Parses a task index from the user input string.
* Converts from 1-based user input to 0-based array index.
* @param start the starting position to parse the index from
* @return the 0-based index for accessing the task list
* @throws ReiExceptions if the index is not a valid number
private static int parseIndex(String input, int start) throws ReiExceptions {
throw new ReiExceptions("OOPS!!! Task number must be a number.");
* Parses a date string into a LocalDateTime object using the expected format.
* @param date the date string to parse in "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm" format
* @throws ReiExceptions if the date string is not in the expected format
private static LocalDateTime parseDate (String date) throws ReiExceptions {
throw new ReiExceptions("Please use yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm format!");
* Handles file operations for storing and loading tasks.
* Manages persistence of task data to and from the file system.
* Constructs a new Storage instance with the specified file path.
* @param filePath the path to the file used for storing tasks
* Loads tasks from the storage file.
* Creates the file and parent directories if they don't exist.
* @return an ArrayList of tasks loaded from the file
* @throws ReiExceptions if there's an error reading from the file
throw new ReiExceptions("OOPS!!! Unable to load tasks from file.");
* Saves the current task list to the storage file.
* @param tasks the TaskList containing all tasks to save
* @throws ReiExceptions if there's an error writing to the file
public void save(TaskList tasks) throws ReiExceptions {
throw new ReiExceptions("OOPS!!! Unable to save tasks to file.");
* Parses a line from the storage file and creates the appropriate task object.
* @param line the line to parse from the file
* @return the Task object created from the line
* @throws ReiExceptions if the line format is invalid or corrupted
private Task parseTask(String line) throws ReiExceptions {
throw new ReiExceptions("OOPS!!! Corrupted data file.");
* Creates a Todo task from parsed file data.
* @param parts the parsed components from the file line
* Creates a Deadline task from parsed file data.
* @param parts the parsed components from the file line
* Creates an Event task from parsed file data.
* @param parts the parsed components from the file line
Task e = new Event(parts[2], from, to);
* Sets the completion status of a task based on the done flag from file.
* @param doneFlag "1" if task is done, "0" if not done
private void setDone(Task task, String doneFlag)
* Represents a task with a deadline that must be completed by a specific date and time.
* Extends the base Task class to include deadline functionality.
* Constructs a new Deadline task with the given description and deadline.
* @param description the description of the deadline task
* @param ddl the deadline date and time when the task must be completed
* Returns a string representation of this deadline task for display.
* @return a formatted string with [D] prefix, status, description, and deadline
* Returns a string representation of this deadline task for file storage.
* @return a formatted string with D prefix and deadline information for saving to file
* Formats a LocalDateTime into a user-friendly display format.
* @param dateTime the date and time to format
* @return a formatted date string in "MMM dd yyyy HH:mm" format
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy HH:mm");
* Represents an event task that occurs during a specific time period.
* Extends the base Task class to include start and end time functionality.
* Constructs a new Event task with the given description, start time, and end time.
* @param description the description of the event
* @param start the start date and time of the event
* @param end the end date and time of the event
public Event(String description, LocalDateTime start, LocalDateTime end) {
* Returns a string representation of this event task for display.
* @return a formatted string with [E] prefix, status, description, and time period
* Returns a string representation of this event task for file storage.
* @return a formatted string with E prefix and time information for saving to file
* Formats a LocalDateTime into a user-friendly display format.
* @param dt the date and time to format
* @return a formatted date string in "MMM dd yyyy HH:mm" format
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy HH:mm");
* Abstract base class representing a task in the Rei application.
* All specific task types (Todo, Deadline, Event) extend this class.
* Constructs a new task with the given description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description the description of the task
* Marks this task as not completed.
* Checks if this task is completed.
* @return true if the task is done, false otherwise
* Gets the done flag as a string for file storage.
* @return "1" if the task is done, "0" otherwise
* Gets the visual status icon for displaying the task completion status.
* @return "[X]" if the task is done, "[ ]" otherwise
* Gets the description of this task.
* Returns a string representation of this task for display purposes.
* @return a formatted string containing the status icon and description
* Returns a string representation of this task for file storage.
* @return a formatted string suitable for saving to file
* Represents a simple todo task without any time constraints.
* Extends the base Task class to provide todo-specific functionality.
* Constructs a new Todo task with the given description.
* @param description the description of the todo task
* Returns a string representation of this todo task for display.
* @return a formatted string with [T] prefix, status icon, and description
* Returns a string representation of this todo task for file storage.
* @return a formatted string with T prefix for saving to file
* Handles user interface operations for the Rei application.
* Manages input reading and output display to the console.
private final Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
* Displays the welcome message when the application starts.
show("What can I do for you?");
* Reads a command from the user input.
* @return the command string entered by the user
* Displays a message to the user.
* Displays a horizontal line separator for visual organization.
* Displays an error message with line separators for emphasis.
* @param message the error message to display
assertTrue(task.isDone(), "Task should be marked as done");
assertFalse(task.isDone(), "Task should be marked as not done");
